    • Method Detail

      • fetchSessionsForMove

        public void fetchSessionsForMove(Move move)
                          throws FileNotFoundException,
                                 ParsingException,
                                 VariableStateException
        Creates a new Move with Sessions added. Reads a move file and all session files in the movement's folder. First creates a Move without Sessions, then adds all the Sessions. Identifies session files in the movement's folder through the file ending using a SessionFileFilter.
        Parameters:
        move - Move to which sessions will be added
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - when a session file cannot be found
        ParsingException - when failing to parse the type of a Variable
        VariableStateException - when a parsed Variable is found not proper
        See Also:
        SessionFileFilter, Move, Session, Set

      • fetchSession

        public Session fetchSession(File sessionFile)
                     throws FileNotFoundException,
                            ParsingException,
                            VariableStateException
        Creates a new Session from a file. Session date is acquired from the file name and a DateTimeFormatter is used to parse the string into a TemporalAccessor. Sets are created from the contents, one line parsed to one Set. into appropriate values.
        Parameters:
        sessionFile - the file to be read
        Returns:
        a new Session populated with Sets, unless the file was empty
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - when the file cannot be found
        ParsingException - when failing to parse the type of a Variable
        VariableStateException - when a parsed Variable is found not proper
        See Also:
        Sessions.parse(java.util.Scanner, java.time.temporal.TemporalAccessor), Session, Set
